snippet: An inquiry found a culture of “fear and intimidation” of staff members and blamed fundamentalist Islamic school board governors.
abstract: Report from Britain's Office for Standards in Education, Children's Services and Skills concludes that pressure from fundamentalist Islamic school board governors had created culture of 'fear and intimidation' among senior staff members in number of British schools; report stops short of saying pressure amounted to conspiracy to impose Islamist views on parts of the education system, as alleged by anonymous letter that first raised alarm about situation.
lead_paragraph: An inquiry found a culture of “fear and intimidation” of staff members and blamed fundamentalist Islamic school board governors.

headline.main: In Britain, School Report Cites Division Over Islam
headline.print_headline: In Britain, School Report Cites Division Over Islam
